page.title: 01Wood Green and its environs
page.content: This block is almost entirely agricultural with two hamlets, Wood Gren, with about 70 people, and the smaller Moor End, ad several farms and isolated dwellings. the track of a Roman road divide the block digonally: the hamlets lie SW in Ardeley parish, centring on its church, school and pub, while the completely agricultural NE gravitates to Buntingford and Westmill. The land is gently rolling with large open fields, low hedes and isolated trees. The principal products are cereal, beans and rape, with some cattle and a pig farm. A water meadow with orchids and an ungrafted pear tree is designated on SSi. Future building is allowable only for agricultural purposes. Middle-class families have recently moved into the SW, here smal businesses include kennels and cabinet
